titles.title: West Coast Ocean Protection Act of 2017
West Coast Ocean Protection Act of 2017
A bill to amend the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act to permanently prohibit the conduct of offshore drilling on the outer Continental Shelf off the coast of California, Oregon, and Washington.
West Coast Ocean Protection Act of 2017

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

bill.summary:
West Coast Ocean Protection Act of 2017
This bill amends the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act to prohibit the Bureau of Ocean Energy Management from issuing a lease for the exploration, development, or production of oil or natural gas in any area of the outer Continental Shelf off the coast of California, Oregon, or Washington.
